question: For 10 months I have had global paresthesia (every part of my body) and have been evaluated for diabetes, heavy metal poisoning, VB12 deficiency, too much VB6, hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism, lyme disease, and with EMG study..  Diagnosis is idiopathic central nervous system disorder.  Treatment is for symptoms - gabapentin and alprazolam.  The global paresthesia is present within minutes of awakening and persists throughout the day and evening (until sleep) at levels ranging from slight to moderate.  The GP came on suddenly and has persisted for 10 months.  I have no other significant symptoms or illness.  I do not smoke and use very little alcohol.  Can anyone come up with a cause and/or treatment regimen?
title: Global Paresthesia
